html:
Etymology[edit]

sapor +‎ -ō

Pronunciation[edit]

  • (Classical) IPA(key): /saˈpoː.roː/
  • (Ecclesiastical) IPA(key): /saˈpo.ro/, [saˈpɔː.rɔ]
  • (Vulgar) IPA(key): /saˈpoː.roː/, [saˈbo.ro]

Verb[edit]

sapōrō (present infinitive sapōrāre, perfect active sapōrāvī, supine sapōrātum); first conjugation

  1. (transitive, Late Latin) I flavour, make tasty

Conjugation[edit]

1The present passive infinitive in -ier is a rare poetic form which is attested for this verb.
2At least one rare poetic syncopated perfect form is attested.

Descendants[edit]

  • French: savourer
  • Italian: saporare

References[edit]

  • saporo in Gaffiot, Félix (1934) Dictionnaire Illustré Latin-Français, Hachette
